image.altText: Man in dark clothing walks down driveway. Text box says Naveed Akram.

props.synopsis: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

title.children: How investigators pieced together the plot to target Bondi

image.altText: A silhouette of a man holding a briefcase with a piano and cruise ship behind him.

props.synopsis: Steven Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

title.children: Fast cars and big debts: The unravelling of Steve Cubis

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: The gas export industry has cost the nation dearly. East coast prices trebled soon after exports began.

title.children: Gas lobby turns to liquid under pressure

image.altText: Illustration of a smartphone showing social media apps, tape saying 'caution 16+ only' across the screen.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth's long-awaited social media ban for under-16s came into effect this month. But some experts note a rise in alternatives to popular platforms as teens find ways to stay active on social media.

title.children: Teens flock to alternative apps after social media ban

image.altText: Three police officers stand in a cordoned off street with one pointing a light at the camera

props.synopsis: Police in Taiwan say Chang Wen purchased grenades, gas canisters and respirators in the year leading up to Friday's attack.

title.children: 'Extremely cunning': Taipei metro attacker planned assault for over a year

image.altText: Overhead shot of a large aircraft carrier warship in the sea with fighter jets lining the deck.

props.synopsis: The Pentagon has moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean. Now President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

title.children: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks

image.altText: A white car sits completely ruined after an explosion with three men standing at the back of it

props.synopsis: The Kremlin is probing who is behind the killing, which has similarities to previous attacks by Ukrainian special services.

title.children: Car bomb kills Russian army general in Moscow, officials say

image.altText: Donald Trump puts a red 'Make America Great Again' baseball cap on his head.

props.synopsis: The release of the Epstein files followed a rare revolt against Donald Trump by some of his dedicated supporters. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

title.children: The Epstein files divided Trump's base and now more fights are brewing

image.altText: A man's hand holds up a flat, silver button battery between his thumb and forefinger. He can be seen standing out of shot.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

title.children: City Beach fined $14m over 'pervasive' button battery safety failures

image.altText: A man with long brown hair, a goatee and moustache wearing a turtleneck jumpber smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

title.children: British singer-songwriter Chris Rea dies aged 74

image.altText: A man and woman stand side-by-side looking at the camera standing in front of a grey stone building

props.synopsis: Residents of the tiny Indonesian island of Pari, which risks being swallowed by rising seas, win the right to have their have their climate change case against cement giant Holcim heard in a Swiss court.

title.children: Swiss court to hear islanders' climate change case against cement giant

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: The Australian share market looks set to open slightly up as the US finishes its trading day with strong gains led by tech stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to open in the green

image.altText: Night club scene with black silhouettes in a crowded warehouse and yellow lights

props.synopsis: AI. Market records. Tariffs. Penguins. TACO. It's been a big year of economic shocks and surges as the international framework of global trade was shredded. Here's how key players saw the year that was.

title.children: A chaotic 'up-crash' for markets riding a turbulent 2025

image.altText: Police forensics officers outside a house.

props.synopsis: A man died after he was stabbed during an altercation in Clyde, in Melbourne's south-east. Just hours later another man was fatally stabbed in Fitzroy.

title.children: Police investigate two fatal stabbings in Melbourne

image.altText: Three men, shirtless, on stage dancing

props.synopsis: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

title.children: Quiz: Can you pick the real Christmas movies from these unhinged plots?

image.altText: a smiling man surrounded by people is blasted with marijuana smoke coming from a long pipe

props.synopsis: Twelve years ago today, Uruguay became the first country to legalise recreational marijuana use. The experiment is still unfolding.

title.children: Uruguay was the first country to legalise marijuana — with mixed results

image.altText: A woman in a blue top laughing outside on a rooftop in a city.

props.synopsis: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

title.children: Vinyl's dirty secret: Why your records hurt the planet

image.altText: A woman cries while holding a tissue in her hand close to her chin

props.synopsis: Bangkok says the two countries will return to the negotiating table this week amid claims the initial peace deal was rushed for Donald Trump.

title.children: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire deal 'rushed' for Donald Trump

image.altText: aerial view of a nuclear plant with three main multistoried white buildings with causeways surrounding a large pool on the coast

props.synopsis: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

title.children: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima

image.altText: Three puffin birds on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

title.children: Thousands of birds are dying on a remote island, with no end in sight

image.altText: A woman with red hair smiles.

props.synopsis: Advocates are pushing for a national framework for addressing domestic violence after an ABC investigation highlighted gaps in the justice system and a lack of information sharing between states.

title.children: National DV register 'could have helped' woman killed by ex-partner, daughter says

image.altText: The back of a man's blue shirt

props.synopsis: Taxpayers have funded $1.6 million in payments to the firefighters union via Fire Rescue Victoria, court documents allege, under an income protection scheme the state's fire chief has said should outrage all Victorians.

title.children: Victoria's fire authority sues firefighters union over taxpayer funds

image.altText: a climbing graph overlay on a person covered with measles

props.synopsis: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

title.children: Measles cases triple in Australia as global outbreaks continue

image.altText: a black 360 degree camera on a high tower

props.synopsis: New cameras using AI have been installed in southern New South Wales forests and are spotting fires before they have a chance to spread.

title.children: New high-tech cameras making a difference to NSW fire fighting

image.altText: a severe storm cell sweeps over brisbane

props.synopsis: The weather bureau is forecasting heavy rainfall and thunderstorms for large parts of the state over the Christmas week, but temperatures are expected to ease.

title.children: Heat to ease as storms ramp up in unsettled Christmas week for Queensland

image.altText: Men sitting around a table during a recording session.

props.synopsis: It has helped keep the Liberals in power in Tasmania and lobbied on behalf of Airbnb, the salmon industry and the Catholic Church — but the PR firm, described as having "fingers in a lot of pies", is closing down.

title.children: PR firm with 'fingers in many pies' to close

image.altText: A close-up of a hand holding a spray can close to a wall.

props.synopsis: A Coolum Beach man is charged with 25 counts of wilful damage following a spate of antisemitic graffiti incidents.

title.children: Queensland man arrested following dozens of antisemitic graffiti offences

image.altText: A sign saying Gosford Police Station

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old who allegedly tried to organise a racial hatred event at Cronulla on the same day as the Bondi Beach terrorist attack is refused bail.

title.children: Man accused of planning racial hatred event at Cronulla refused bail

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt smiles outside his house which is swamped by Christmas lights

props.synopsis: Families from all over Adelaide visit Joe Ferraro's home to marvel at his Christmas display, which he has amassed a collection of more than 50,000 lights since he began nearly 20 years ago.

title.children: The Christmas display that charms kids, adults and nuns visiting on a minibus

image.altText: The coroners court sign at Lidcombe.

props.synopsis: The NSW Coroners Court hands down findings into the 2023 death of a young Indigenous mother after a doctor gave evidence the woman may have died from "broken-heart syndrome".

title.children: Doctor tells inquest woman may have died from 'broken-heart syndrome'

image.altText: Prince William and son George smile whilst volunteering at homelessness charity.

props.synopsis: From America, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex have also sent out their Christmas wishes on Instagram.

title.children: Prince William and son George volunteer at homelessness charity

image.altText: A man in a beekeeping suit holds a hive frame which is covered in bees

props.synopsis: The varroa mite may be tiny — only a millimetre or two long — but it poses a huge threat to honey bees, beekeepers and honey producers, who are on high alert after the destructive mite's recent arrival in South Australia.

title.children: Tiny, destructive varroa mite has SA beekeepers on high alert

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios waves his racquet with his right hand at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: After a career-best year, Queenslander Priscilla Hon was among four Australian Open wildcards named on Monday, but Nick Kyrgios was not among them.

title.children: Kyrgios not offered Australian Open wildcard — yet

image.altText: Two women in active wear pose in front of an orange and blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

title.children: The Sunday football session that sparked a sporting movement for Indian women
